KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!31.001!DE.dialogue_text: Having read the documents, there is now little else to occupy Eidos in this wretched place. Though another quick survey of the clutter seems to call her attention to another possible tome...\n\n\t\tThe mess of tomes littering the defunct Librarian's squatted residence make it difficult to navigate, yet it is still clear to Eidos that she could make use of the raft downstairs, floating upon the subterranean lake, or she could simply take the nearby stairs descending further into complex.

D.response_text: Take Quangjo's raft

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!31.002!DE.dialogue_text:
A dream? Perhaps, but if life is dreaming, then to awaken is death. Passing through the Door of Night and abandoning the Falseflesh leaving only behind the memory of the Trueflesh in its stead... These are the preoccupations of the inexperienced, of the unaware.

		Eidos knows that though shells may change, death is but the stillness between breaths. For her a millennia may pass in an instant, a civilization may rise and fall in the blink of her eye, entire cosmos may form and re-collapse within the space of her thoughts.

		No, this vessel she now occupies is not her; these vessels all occupy are perhaps but one, living the same existence and repeating it in an unending cycle...

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!31.003!DE.dialogue_text: The sound of a collapsing stack of rotten shelves brings Eidos' ghost racing back to its current vehicle. She quickly rolls away to relative safety, and into a stinking pile of refuse. Yet she rises, unfazed, and brushes the days-old fish innards off her robe. The soiled traveler then looks about the ruined Archives.

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!32.000!DE.dialogue_text: The mess of tomes littering the defunct Librarian's squatted residence make it difficult to navigate, yet it is still clear to Eidos that she could make use of the raft, floating upon the subterranean lake, or she could simply take the nearby stairs descending further into complex.

D.response_text: Take Quangjo's raft

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.X000!D.dialogue_text: This place was evidently a library at some point. Tomes line the shelves of all bookcases that have not yet collapsed, and by the rotten, moldy smell that pervades, even these shelves have been eaten away by the dampness all around. More tomes are also strewn about the wet floor, vomited forth from crippled piles of wooden debris.\n\n\t\tThe only path unimpeded is a narrow stretch leading to separate oases in the sea of volumes and folios. A large table, a reading chair and a pathetic looking bedroll seem to indicate this is a makeshift residence.

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.0000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos notes another passage leading out of here, but the shadows lie too thick there to see where it might lead. The light guides her eyes to its source and only then does she finally realize she is not alone in this room...

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.X0001!.dialogue_text: At a large table, sits a frail man, scribbling away at some piece of writing, constantly muttering to himself.

D.response_text: Attempt to sneak past to the other exit

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.00000!.dialogue_text: This place was evidently a library at some point. Tomes line the shelves of all bookcases that have not yet collapsed, and by the rotten, moldy smell that pervades, even these shelves have been eaten away by the dampness all around. More tomes are also strewn about the wet floor, vomited forth from crippled piles of wooden debris.\n\n\t\tThe only path unimpeded is a narrow stretch leading to separate oases in the sea of volumes and folios. A large table, a reading chair and a pathetic looking bedroll seem to indicate this is a makeshift residence.

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.00001!.dialogue_text: Eidos notes another passage leading out of here, but the shadows lie too thick there to see where it might lead. The light guides her eyes to its source and only then does she finally realize she is not alone in this room...

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.X00002.dialogue_text: At a large table, sits a frail man, scribbling away at some piece of writing, constantly muttering to himself.

D.response_text: Stay and eavesdrop

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.001!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos tries to sneak over to the passageway opposite her. Each muffled footfall rings out several times as the echoes collide with innumerable surfaces. The man sharply turns to face her as soon as he senses her presence, a look of terror gripping him, contorting his face into an unholy configuration.

E.response_text: Attack

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!41.X002!D.dialogue_text: Without warning, the man leaps to his feet, a bloodied knife now in hand. With a silent scream, he lunges towards Eidos. She raises her hands up in time for the crazed being to crash into her. The two tumble through the doorway back into the stairwell...

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!43.X000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos hears the whispering babble of the crazed individual. He mentions words like "mission", "poison" and "Glyph". Abruptly, he ceases his writing and speaking. Slowly, his quill lowers. His hooded head begins to rise, at the speed of his spreading horror upon realizing he is watched from the shadows. As his head reaches its zenith, his hood falls off. His head jerks violently toward his left as he fixes his terror-worn eyes directly upon Eidos.

E.response_text: Attack

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!50.000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos fumbles with the mechanism, but it is locked from the other side and the door holds fast. There is nowhere to go but down.

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.000!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mmm! You see? Even in exile I've found a new Archive! Biracul, it seems, has ordained that I must ever be in the company of the dead."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.0000!QU.dialogue_text: "For reading an old tome is like opening a forgotten crypt, isn't it? There're so many bones here I must sift through, yes. But, I must to hear these last breaths of the dead!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.0001!QU.dialogue_text: "What was their true thought? Perhaps it is this that brings you to the Archive of the Wellspring? Yes? Are we to be ghouls together?"

A.response_text: "Actually, I'd like to know more about you, Quangjo."

B.response_text: "What knowledge lies in this vast library?"

C.response_text: "I don't know why I'm here, honestly."

D.response_text: "Before, you spoke of a lurking danger... Tell me of it."

E.response_text: "You talk much, yet I hear nothing useful."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.100!QUA.dialogue_text: "That's a subject for which I'm ill-prepared to discuss. Yes, my past and purpose have become confused!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.1000!QU.dialogue_text: "I find myself back here, in the present, not the past. The Wellspring is my home now. I've become its native son!"

E.response_text: "Why was the lake poisoned?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.200!QUA.dialogue_text: "I've read much! But the greatest tome is that which I've only begun to decipher... Yes, the Wellspring itself!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2000!QU.dialogue_text: "It's a living testament of much that came before. And that which may follow after..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2001!QU.dialogue_text: "The Vanquished may have written the first entries, but many hands have shaped its current narrative!"

A.response_text: "Why do you remain here? Is there more to learn?"

C.response_text: "What purpose does the Wellspring have for your people?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.300!QUA.dialogue_text: "Yes, mmm, then we've something in common! I'm here for many, many, multitudinous reasons. Many purposes!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3000!QU.dialogue_text: "But what am I to do? Which master should I serve, Quangjo?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3001!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, but for now, I'll act as I've done, and be a Librarian once more!"

C.response_text: "What purpose does the Wellspring have for your people?"

D.response_text: "How can I survive the perils of this place?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.400!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mmm, this place is rife with peril!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4000!QU.dialogue_text: "The Arclight spirits'll lash your body and mind with explosions of agony and luminescence, should you violate their domains."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4001!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, the Neverborn sentinels send your souls flying to Biracul in the Graylands, should you confront them..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4002!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, well no, but these are all mercies of the Wellspring! To protect you from the tainted water..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4003!QU.dialogue_text: "And yet! Worse than these, is the Shadow hunting me!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4004!QU.dialogue_text: "It found me on the road to this place. I fear, It has followed me here, sniffing me out in my dreams. That is why I refrain from sleep! Clever, Quangjo, yes!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4005!QU.dialogue_text: "We can ill-afford an encounter with It. Let's pray Biracul keeps it from us! It's not of the Wellspring, no; nor is It of our ilk!"

C.response_text: "What purpose does the Wellspring have for your people?"

D.response_text: "How can I survive the perils of this place?"

E.response_text: "Why was the lake poisoned?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.500!QUA.dialogue_text: "Yes, mmm, if you tire of my words, perhaps you should spend time listening to the Wellspring. It's all around us. Ever speaking of the past."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5000!QU.dialogue_text: "I'm well acquainted with its speech. To me, its mutterings and whispers are so voluminous, as to keep me from sleep. That's if I were to indulge in such weakness of the Falseflesh!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5001!QU.dialogue_text: "But I shall try to act as interpreter. Yes, what would be useful to you?"

D.response_text: "How can I survive the perils of this place?"

E.response_text: "Why was the lake poisoned?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.101!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mmm, you see, yes, generations of magi have already delved and plundered the Wellspring for power and secrets, and none are worse than my master, Khaa."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.1010!QU.dialogue_text: "But there is still so much to learn! What became of Luin after Ark descended into the Graylands? It no longer resides in the Wellspring, that much is certain!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X1011!Q.dialogue_text: "Where're the Beasts of the Vedt? The war machines that the Heathen was said to have left as the Wellspring's ultimate guardians? And of course, the Glyphs!"

B.response_text: "What does Khaa mean to steal from here?"

E.response_text: "Why's Khaa so powerful?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.1012!QU.dialogue_text: "Where're the Beasts of the Vedt? The war machines that the Heathen was said to have left as the Wellspring's ultimate guardians? And of course, the Glyphs!"

A.response_text: "I've met Khaa. Please, tell me what you know of him."

B.response_text: "What does Khaa mean to steal from here?"

E.response_text: "Why's Khaa so powerful?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.201!QUA.dialogue_text: "Yes, mmm, the Wellspring is the only source of water for Dazir, Tambul and the Dawn fortress. However it only became so through the labors of an Adepti Heathen - the very heathen enemy of our ancestors! His flesh was burned and eaten to seal his covenant!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2010!QU.dialogue_text: "The first Daziran artisans would festoon the entry in their sacraments to the Shining One. All was as it should have been... For a time!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2011!QU.dialogue_text: "It was only with Ark, driven mad by the death-Jinns that true heresy took root!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X2012!Q.dialogue_text: "Yes, since then generations of magi have delved and plundered the Wellspring for power and secrets. Now, it comes to flower with my master, Khaa."

B.response_text: "What does Khaa mean to steal from here?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2013!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, since then generations of magi have delved and plundered the Wellspring for power and secrets. Now, it comes to flower with my master, Khaa."

A.response_text: "I've met Khaa. Please, tell me what you know of him."

B.response_text: "What does Khaa mean to steal from here?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.301!QUA.dialogue_text: "Yes, mmm, the Wellspring is the only source of water for Dazir, Tambul and the Dawn fortress. However it only became so through the labors of an Adepti Heathen - the very heathen enemy of our ancestors! His flesh was burned and eaten to seal his covenant!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3010!QU.dialogue_text: "The first Daziran artisans would festoon the entry in their sacraments to the Shining One. All was as it should have been... For a time!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3011!QU.dialogue_text: "It was only with Ark, driven mad by the death-Jinns that true heresy took root!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3012!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, since then generations of magi have delved and plundered the Wellspring for power and secrets. Now, it comes to flower with my master, Khaa."

B.response_text: "What does Khaa mean to steal from here?"

D.response_text: "And what of you? What can you teach me?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.401!QUA.dialogue_text: "Ah ha! Yes, the arclights can be subdued if one possess the Heathen's Sigil, as Khaa does!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4010!QU.dialogue_text: "However, the Neverborn are more difficult! The Clockwork Crows are too nimble, and the Sabine Sentinels are nearly indestructible!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4011!QU.dialogue_text: "Mmm, only Ark was able to slay them, but she was armed with Luin - yet even that might not be enough anymore..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4012!QU.dialogue_text: "All can be overcome if you can discover the Throne of Power. But even then, one would need to know the language of the Vanquished, yes."

D.response_text: "What abilities can I learn from you?"

E.response_text: "Why's Khaa so powerful?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.501!QUA.dialogue_text: "It was Khaa! Yes, the most recent history of the Wellspring is co-authored by him..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5010!QU.dialogue_text: "While he lacks my understanding, his ignorance was a strength. Yes!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X5011!Q.dialogue_text: "Only an individual as learned as myself knows enough to be paralyzed with fear!"

D.response_text: "And what of you? What can you teach me?"

E.response_text: "Who is Khaa's 'co-author'?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5012!QU.dialogue_text: "Only an individual as learned as myself knows enough to be paralyzed with fear!"

A.response_text: "I've met Khaa. Please, tell me what you know of him."

D.response_text: "And what of you? What can you teach me?"

E.response_text: "Who is Khaa's 'co-author'?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.102!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mage and leader of Dazir, yes? But he does not wish to maintain the Wellspring as has been commanded by Biracul from the beginning!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.1020!QU.dialogue_text: "No, no, he merely wishes to use the power dwelling within to destroy his enemies. And he will succeed!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.1021!QU.dialogue_text: "The Wellspring has accepted his blood offering and the Sa'Ma resides in the Tacribian waters! The corruption is, without doubt, the most faithful and undiscriminating servant of all."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X1022!Q.dialogue_text: "Am I then, to use the Glyph of Purification? Or to release the poisoned brew? Which master to serve, Quangjo? It's all too much! Too many masters; How can I be faithful to all!?"

B.response_text: "Why does Khaa wish to kill others?"

E.response_text: "If you have some power, you'll give it to me now."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.202!QUA.dialogue_text: "Khaa can take nothing from the Wellspring. No, no, he is no Ark, after all!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2020!QU.dialogue_text: "So he was forced to give. An offering to invert that offered by the Heathen."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.2021!QU.dialogue_text: "Before, death was offered to sustain life; now Khaa has offered life in exchange for death!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X2022!Q.dialogue_text: "The Wellspring has accepted, yes, and the Sa'Ma resides in the Tacribian waters! It is, without doubt, the most faithful and indiscriminate servant of all."

B.response_text: "Why does Khaa wish to kill others?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.302!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mmm, is there an escape from here? I don't know. Isn't that strange? I've learned so much of this place. But I've ever only walked in perpetual spirals here."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.3020!QU.dialogue_text: "I know of no world outside the Wellspring anymore. I cannot explain my memories of Dazir nor my knowledge of Kabu, yes."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X3021!Q.dialogue_text: "Why do I remember Khaa and his will? Perhaps, I merely read about these places."

B.response_text: "Why does Khaa wish to kill others?"

D.response_text: "Who are your masters? Tell me what's going on!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.402!QUA.dialogue_text: "Yes, the Wellspring has taught me much. I've labored long, haven't I? Was it all in vain?!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4020!QU.dialogue_text: "No! I've learned the Glyph of Purification! But how can I make use of it? How can I go against my master?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.4021!QU.dialogue_text: "No, I'm afraid I can no longer help Logira. Never? No, I must languish here in darkest doubt..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X4022!Q.dialogue_text: "Now, I'm faithful to none but oblivion!"

D.response_text: "Who are your masters? Be clear, man!"

E.response_text: "You're nothing but a babbling fool."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.502!QUA.dialogue_text: "Mmm, yes, a jinncursed stranger, disguised as a mage was It! It came to Dazir from out of the Jenowin Plain and sought sanctuary!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5020!QU.dialogue_text: "Soon, It had Khaa's ear, telling him of Techne and lore thought lost in the Great Awakening. Oh! But It claimed it was found in a distant country, yes..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.5021!QU.dialogue_text: "An absurdity! Given how far removed Its realm is from our place and time!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!0.X5022!Q.dialogue_text: "I know this, for I too have met Mifas'cul, while on the road here, yes."

D.response_text: "Who are your masters? Speak clearly, you idiot!"

E.response_text: "You're a waste of skin."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!1.X000!QU.dialogue_text: "Shhh! Be silent! Don't you hear It?!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.000!QUA.dialogue_text: "Ah! No! It has come! Despite all my efforts to secrecy, It has found me again! And It won't be pleased that I'm speaking with you, no It won't!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.0000!QU.dialogue_text: "NO! It'll be wrathful at the thought I've played the part of Librarian once more!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.0001!QU.dialogue_text: "Leave this place now, I urge you! You must escape down the passage to the lower level!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.0002!QU.dialogue_text: "It'll be the death of us both if we're discovered!"

D.response_text: "Yes, you stay here and distract it, brave Quangjo..."

E.response_text: "I fear nothing. I'll depart when I please!"

F.response_text: "Sorry, partner! There ain't room enough for two loons in this Archives!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.100!QUA.dialogue_text: "No, Eidos. I'm afraid we'll never meet again... Nothing but the Door of Night awaits me; my Trueflesh won't find Ark in the Graylands... it'll surely be undone, even before the Falseflesh decays."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.1000!QU.dialogue_text: "But I deserve no pity! I was too weak to help you, yes. Too weak to help anyone..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.1001!QU.dialogue_text: "At the least, I hope that my undoing will grant others life... in the lower area, at the Flood Gate, you'll meet a guardian spirit. If you'd preserve life, leave it in peace. No good will come of its death."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.200!QUA.dialogue_text: "No, no time to explain, Eidos! It'll dismantle your Trueflesh, as It did mine."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!2.2000!QU.dialogue_text: "I'm just a prisoner of this horrid place by Its design! No more can I face the world without. I'm condemned to live with the minds that moulder here..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!3.000!QUA.dialogue_text: "Escape, Eidos! And don't return to the Wellspring, no!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!3.0000!QU.dialogue_text: "May Biracul guide you to a safer road than mine..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!10.000!QU.dialogue_text: "Ah ha! Mmm, yes, Logira. I've worked hard. I've searched these tomes until my fingers bled and my eyes watered, yes..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!10.00010!.dialogue_text: "You felt its effects earlier, yes. But now you shall observe!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!10.X0002!.dialogue_text: "These cave fish are immune to the effects of the Sa'Ma, yet their blood is filthy with it!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!11.000!QU.dialogue_text: "You see? Yes, I swear it in Biracul's name that I will not perish! The Purification Glyph is ours, Logira. Ours!!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!11.X0000!.dialogue_text: "Now, you and your people don't need to walk the Graylands! No! No... n..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!12.000!QU.dialogue_text: "...Logira. I'm so sorry, yes. No, I'm afraid I cannot give you the Glyph..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!12.0000!Q.dialogue_text: "You'll never know how much I want to save you. Your people. I owe you nothing less than my very life!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!12.0001!Q.dialogue_text: "Yes, but what good is my life when my Trueflesh has rotted to the core?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!12.0002!Q.dialogue_text: "On the road to the Wellspring, all purpose became confused by It. No! It won't allow me to give it to you. It wishes for you all to die... or some... or... AH! Its true intent is unfathomable."

D.response_text: "Why does it wish to kill... me?"

E.response_text: "And 'a wish' is all it'll remain."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!12.302!QU.dialogue_text: "Don't you see it?! In the doorway!"

D.response_text: "...Don't cry, Quangjo. Logira is here."

E.response_text: "Stop crying, you fool."

F.response_text: "This reminds me of a Roostorian hymn: 'Fish Blood on a Friday Night'."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.000!QU.dialogue_text: "Ah ha! Mmm, yes, master Khaa. I've worked hard. Worked your bidding!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.0000!Q.dialogue_text: "The water of the Wellspring has been infected by the Sa'Ma, yes. The Tacribians shall indeed perish by the curse which brought to us Biracul!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.0001!Q.dialogue_text: "All is as you willed, yes, but... forgive me, master; I haven't yet finished my mission."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.0002!Q.dialogue_text: "No, while I've discovered the means to open the Flood Gate that supplies the Dawn Fortress, I haven't yet release the infected water, no. What do you will of me?"

A.response_text: "I wish to know your opinion on the situation."

D.response_text: "Why are you still here?"

E.response_text: "Tell me what you can do for me. Now."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.100!QU.dialogue_text: "Mmm, yes, if I had gone to the Flood Gate below and confronted the Arclight, the crystal explosion would have cracked the dam and released the tainted water, though I wouldn't have survived the encounter, no."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.1000!Q.dialogue_text: "However, my time down here has not been wasted, master! I have also discovered the Glyph of Purification. Yes! But..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.1001!Q.dialogue_text: "I implore you master, turn aside from your plan to poison the Tacribians, yes?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.1002!Q.dialogue_text: "I've kept the company of the dead and all of them whisper a plea for life! Don't forget your sacred duty as a mage of Kabu, as a servant of the Shining One... Please..."

A.response_text: "Of course I won't kill the Tacribians. Cleanse the water!"

D.response_text: "I care not for your sentiment; carry out your mission and open the gate!"

E.response_text: "Do nothing! I'll take action myself, you incompetent fool."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.400!QU.dialogue_text: "Mmm, yes, I met with master Mifas'cul on my way here. My mind was... corrupted by Its influence and I became confused."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.4000!Q.dialogue_text: "I found myself powerless. But now, I can do as you would will me to, yes. I can go to the Flood Gate below and confront the Arclight. This will release the tainted water. But..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.4001!Q.dialogue_text: "Master, I've not been idle here, no! I've discovered the Glyph of Purification! If you'd turn aside from your plan, if you didn't want to poison the Tacribian League, then I now have the means to remove the jinnvenom, yes!"

A.response_text: "Of course I won't kill the Tacribians. Cleanse the water!"

D.response_text: "I care not for your sentiment; carry out your mission and open the gate!"

E.response_text: "Do nothing! I'll take action myself, you incompetent fool."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.500!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes, if I were to go to the Flood Gate below and confront the Arclight, I'd be able to release the corrupted water, thereby ending the Tacribian League - though I wouldn't survive the encounter, no. But..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.101!QU.dialogue_text: "Yes! Master, you are as merciful as Biracul! I knew you were no Jinn, for I too have looked upon Them and they are ugly and inhuman!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.1010!Q.dialogue_text: "We can purify the water, yes, sparing them from a death of thirst! YES!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.1011!Q.dialogue_text: "Master, I ask that you accompany me. Should I fail, yes, you will be the only one who can undo what has been done here!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.401!QU.dialogue_text: "No! I despise my weakness. What can I do in the face of such power and conviction?!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.4010!Q.dialogue_text: "Yes, I go to my death and the death of our Tacribian brothers..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.4011!Q.dialogue_text: "But remember Khaa! As we are, so too shall you be!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.4012!Q.dialogue_text: "Now we go... to the Flood Gate..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.501!QU.dialogue_text: "Mmm, I beg of you, master Khaa! Do no more harm, no!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.5010!Q.dialogue_text: "Be as merciful as Biracul, the mage of magi, yes..?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!20.5011!Q.dialogue_text: "I shall remain at your side as we go to the Flood Gate, in case you've further use of me."

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!30.000!QU.dialogue_text: "What goes there?! What is It that watches me?!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!30.0001!Q.dialogue_text: "...for Quangjo can no longer be found here if you are, no! I am but a ghostless shell!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!RUINED ARCHIVE!30.0002!Q.dialogue_text: "Or... could it be? Logira?! No... master Khaa then? Impossible!"

E.response_text: "Only open your mouth again if you want to die..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!0.00.dialogue_text: Five corners mark where the walls' edges meet. The walls seem reflections of the floor, extending upwards like the petals of a metallic rose in bloom. The ceiling is but another reflection of the floor and walls, though shifted in phase and angle. All sides of this chamber bear radiant crystalline structures, each of which pulsates rhythmically like the beating of an elemental heart.\n\n\t\tThe composition of the walls is difficult to determine, their reflective but harsh sheen looking like a strange fusion of mineral and metal. On the floor, Eidos sees countless silvered lines etched within this material. They run in cascades of parallel lines, dividing, flowing and rejoining at harsh angles, birthing from them the skeleton of a massive Glyph...

The dizzying sight of this unfinished Glyph appears to frame what should have been the most salient element of the room; Eidos sees lying prone within the confines of the lines a hulking mound. Thrice as tall as the observer in height and width, yet more than double that in depth, the beast towers over Eidos even when lying down. Its surface is composed of interlocking metallic plates, their cobalt sheen broken by seams that shift in color between a dim gray and a brilliantly luminescent yellow. The change in hue occurs in slow pulses in time with the pulse of the surrounding wall crystals.

Then, slowly but steadily, the metallic behemoth begins to move. With a sibilant sound as if steel ground on a whetstone, the plates unfold and separate from each other. The form of an immense quadrupedal monstrosity unfurls. Standing more than four times her height, it ponderously turns its massive head toward Eidos, a furious intellect apparent in its unerring gaze.\n\n\t\tSoon, a seam slowly reveals itself in the smooth surface of its face as it unhinges a gaping jaw - its maw filled with cruel teeth jutting from metallic lips, all of a single, unbroken piece. Rising from its reclined position and with grace defying its bulk, it marches towards Eidos...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!1.00.dialogue_text: The monster collapses, cerulean ichor oozing from its wounds. With this beast slain, the power in the Wellspring is extinguished; water ceases to well up from the ground and the flow of water through its aqueducts is stemmed. Now it is no longer just Tacribians who thirst, but rather the entirety of the Kaban region. With the end of water comes the end of Kabu...

The realization hits Eidos and she falls to her knees. The game is over, the play has finished, and she has left her indelible mark on the world. Yet, in that moment, Eidos senses the very last unfractured crystal embedded within the beast calls out to her, the mental defenses of her adversary laid bare before her. A plea for memory. A desire to not be dealt the final death of forgetting...\n\n\t\tFor a brief instant, she feels a hunger within her mind. As though awakened by the smell of blood, Eidos can sense the ravening jaws of Fenrir.

D.response_text: Escape reality

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!1.00.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.\n\n\t\tEidos calls the Glyph of Fenrir to mind, and using the Techne of Extraction she consumes the soul of Gulganna; her final act this time.
Eidos gives in to desperation, now resolving to end her journey at this juncture. Yet, a flash of insight flares within her...
One person's end is simply another's beginning.
Though the Falseflesh may perish and decay here, Trueflesh persists in perpetuity... so long as the will to persist exists.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!2.00.dialogue_text: The beast, now under Eidos' command, obediently returns to its original position. In that moment, Eidos senses that one of the myriad crystals embedded within the monstrosity calls out to her.

D.response_text: Exit Gulganna's chamber

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!2.00.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.\n\n\t\tEidos calls the Glyph of Fenrir to mind, and using the Techne of Extraction she consumes the soul of Gulganna.
Eidos now continues along her path to witness the effects she has had on the world.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!10.0.dialogue_text: Five corners mark where the walls' edges meet. The walls seem reflections of the floor, extending upwards like the petals of a metallic rose in bloom. The ceiling is but another reflection of the floor and walls, though shifted in phase and angle. All sides of this chamber bear radiant crystalline structures, each of which pulsates rhythmically like the beating of an elemental heart.\n\n\t\tThe composition of the walls is difficult to determine, their reflective but harsh sheen looking like a strange fusion of mineral and metal. Moreover, looking down at the floor, Eidos sees countless silvered lines etched within this material. They run in cascades of parallel lines, dividing, flowing and rejoining at harsh angles, birthing from them the skeleton of a massive Glyph...

The dizzying sight of this unfinished Glyph appears to frame what should have been the most salient element of the room; Eidos sees lying prone within the confines of the lines a hulking mound. Thrice as tall as the observer in height and width, yet more than double that in depth, the beast towers over Eidos even when lying down. Its surface is composed of interlocking metallic plates, their cobalt sheen broken by seams that shift in color between a dim gray and a brilliantly luminescent yellow. The change in hue occurs in slow pulses in time with the pulse of the surrounding wall crystals.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!10.X.dialogue_text:
Then, slowly but steadily, the metallic behemoth begins to move. With a sibilant sound as if steel ground on a whetstone, the plates unfold and separate from each other. The form of an immense quadrupedal monstrosity unfurls. Standing more than four times her height, it ponderously turns its massive head toward Eidos, a furious intellect apparent in its unerring gaze.

		Soon, a seam slowly reveals itself in the smooth surface of its face as it unhinges a gaping jaw - a maw filled with cruel teeth jutting from its metallic lip, all of a single, unbroken piece. Rising from its reclined position and with grace defying its bulk, it marches towards Eidos...

		Yet, the frail Librarian seems utterly unaffected. His habitually watery eyes simply stare ahead as he walks resolutely towards a dark glass panel nearby.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!11.0.dialogue_text: As Quangjo finishes speaking, a hissing sound screams out from the exit. The gate leading back to the Throne Room seals shut once more. Before Eidos can react, Quangjo draws a rust-covered blade from his sleeve and drives it through the dark glass. The sound of shattering crystal is followed by a blinding flash of light and the shock wave of an explosion...

Blurry shapes pass across her vision. But when it returns, Eidos sees Quangjo's crumpled frame lying still upon the floor in a smoldering heap. Her companion's arm has been separated from his fragile frame, and the smell of burning cloth and flesh heavily permeates the air...\n\n\t\tEidos begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull... a growing sense of clarity... an unambiguous awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, all attempting to etch themselves within her mind.

Blurry shapes pass across her vision. But when it returns, Eidos sees Quangjo's crumpled frame lying still upon the floor in a smoldering heap. Her companion's arm has been separated from his fragile frame, and the smell of burning cloth and flesh heavily permeates the air...\n\n\t\tEidos begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull... a growing sense of clarity... an unambiguous awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, all attempting to etch themselves within her mind. Yet one calls stronger than any other...

Blurry shapes pass across her vision. But when it returns, Eidos sees Quangjo's crumpled frame lying still upon the floor in a smoldering heap. Her companion's arm has been separated from his fragile frame, and the smell of burning cloth and flesh heavily permeates the air...\n\n\t\tEidos begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull... a growing sense of clarity... an unambiguous awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, all attempting to etch themselves within her mind. Yet one calls stronger than any other...

Blurry shapes pass across her vision. But when it returns, Eidos sees Quangjo's crumpled frame lying still upon the floor in a smoldering heap. Her companion's arm has been separated from his fragile frame, and the smell of burning cloth and flesh heavily permeates the air...

Abruptly, she is seized by a vision of feverish labor. Black inked fingers. The taste of fish. The smell of tome-rot. A gnawing sense of impending doom. Wasted hours of panic and terror. Certainty that she is being watched from within. Desperation. Hunger. Fear. And beyond, streets of white quartz stained with seething shadows - or is it the ink upon the tomes? A winged creature watches her from atop a heaven-piercing spire. And suddenly...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!12.0.dialogue_text: Her mind is filled with a new awareness. Words and notions that are not her own invade the foundations of her consciousness. She hears her voice screaming a litany of alien utterances that soon take shape as pleas for reprieve and mercy. And then...

Eidos shields her will against the living knowledge that appears before her mind's eye. Slowly, she feels the urgent call subside as whatever structures supporting the vitality of the symbols withers away...

With Quangjo lying dead and his knowledge absorbed, there is nothing but the beast and Eidos in the room. With footsteps compelled by circumstance, she steps towards the gargantuan monstrosity as it glowers at her, mouth agape.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!14.0.dialogue_text: A hissing sound screams out from the exit, and the gate leading back to the Throne Room seals shut once more. Before Eidos can react, Quangjo draws a rust-covered blade from his sleeve and drives it through the dark glass. The sound of shattering crystal is followed by a blinding flash of light and the shock wave of an explosion...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!15.0.dialogue_text: The monster collapses, cerulean ichor oozing from its wounds. The crystals of the chamber immediately dim and the only illumination becomes the fading phosphorescence of the beast's lifeblood. An empathic radiation wells up from within the creature and Eidos becomes aware of sensations outside of herself. As the life of the Neverborn behemoth ebbs, she can feel the power within the Wellspring itself likewise expire. Like blood pooling within a corpse, Eidos can feel the water cease flowing within the pumping stations and aqueducts.\n\n\t\tAnd suddenly, the realization dawns upon Eidos...
She is trapped within this chamber. The door mechanism now sealed and irreparable condemns her to join Gulganna in death.

She she falls to her knees, and in that moment, Eidos senses the mental defenses of her adversary laid bare before her. A plea for memory. A desire to not be dealt the final death of forgetting. For a brief instant, she feels a hunger within her mind. As though awakened by the smell of blood, Eidos can sense the ravening jaws of Fenrir...

D.response_text: Deny the hunger and escape reality

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!15.2.dialogue_text: The beast, now under Eidos' command, returns to its original position. In that moment, Eidos senses the mental defenses of her adversary have been laid bare. For a brief instant, she feels a hunger within her mind. As though awakened by the smell of blood, Eidos can sense the ravening jaws of Fenrir...

D.response_text: Deny the hunger within

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!15.2.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.\n\n\t\tEidos calls the Glyph of Fenrir to mind, and using the Techne of Extraction she consumes the soul of Gulganna.

Closing her mind to the lust for Trueflesh, she witnesses the unsated wolf vanishing into a misty haze. Stepping from the pacified Gulganna and the cooling corpse of Quangjo, Eidos walks back to the gate. Responding to the Sigil of Wulfias, the way back opens.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!20.0.dialogue_text: With Quangjo, lifeless and still, there is nothing but the beast and Eidos in the room. The creature lunges at Eidos, its gaping maw threatening to rent her flesh from her bones...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!90.X.dialogue_text: Eidos senses the mental defenses of her adversary have been laid bare. For a brief instant, she feels a hunger within her mind. As though awakened by the smell of blood, Eidos can sense the ravening jaws of Fenrir...

D.response_text: Return to Throne Room

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!90.0.dialogue_text: The brilliant, crystal-encrusted husk of Gulganna lies here, soulless. Its Trueflesh woven with Eidos, Gulganna can avoid a true death. Yet, be that as it may, there is no longer anything for Eidos in this Sanctum. However, there is always the option to wander the labyrinth of the past and linger in a barren place.

And linger she does, wandering the infinite hallways of the past, in an unending loop stopping at the present and then rewinding to her starting point as the Singularity. Constantly rewinding until she arrives back at the present from the depths of the past as they curved through the future.

D.response_text: Escape reality

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!90.0.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.\n\n\t\tEidos calls the Glyph of Fenrir and her mind becomes possessed by the Techne of Extraction. She can feel the wolf's steamy breath eddy about her as her consciousness reaches out to grasp their prey. In a frenzy, she consumes the soul of Gulganna, her final act in this incarnation.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!0.00.dialogue_text: "This beast will fall as its brother did at Ark's hand! For the good of Kabu!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GULGANNA!1.00.dialogue_text: "Master, we must die. No. No! I've helped you kill the folk of the Dawn Fortress! For that, we are both of us doomed to wander the Crimson Fields with Famlaz! But the Jinns have done enough work for one day."
"As the Heathen did long ago, so shall we return to dust; yet our deaths will give way to new life! May Biracul watch over you from the Empyrean, master; me, he had abandoned already, long ago..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.X0.dialogue_text: As Eidos reaches the end of the passage, the sporadic reflections of metallic sheen sparkle at her arrival. She now stands in a chamber built up of a great many walls rising around her in the shape of an irregular orb. Each wall appears to be a five-sided surface, though thick clouds of incense smoke make their exact number difficult to determine. Here too, stars peek through small cracks in the ceiling, but the rays are diffused by the stale smoky vapors.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.00.dialogue_text: Searching through the haze, Eidos observes that the smoke arises from the past exhalations of five braziers, one in each of the floor's corners. Only the slightest hint of red abides within them to hint at their dying embers. They surround a great mass at the chamber's center, a heap of material indistinct in the gloom. Traced white chalk patterns adorn the floor, as they did in the Silver Shrine whence she came, yet the relative lack of luminescence renders them dull and lifeless by comparison.

Unlit candles likewise dot the landscape, surrounding mounds of glass shards at various points in the spiraling patterns. Bowls of sacrifice have been placed upon these shards, though they seem to lie empty. The source of the glass becomes apparent as Eidos turns her gaze to the walls and ceiling. The entire area is studded with large crystalline mounds, most broken and ruined.

At last, Eidos reaches the center of the room, just as her eyes adjust to the murky haze. What light does shine into this chamber is reflected off the lightly dusted, massive cobalt mound resting before her.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.10.dialogue_text: Eidos squints to focus her vision in an effort to discern the nature of this metallic heap. In time, her mind brings the details into focus and comes to the startling realization that she is gazing into the lifeless eye of a once-animated behemoth. She leaps back in surprise before steadying herself. The mound is of tremendous size, dwarfing her many times over. Though it may have been mighty in life, this inert monstrosity now poses no threat.

Composure regained, Eidos begins to circle the body, noticing numerous dimly glowing, green gashes marring the corpse's metal carapace. While the chamber is too dark to look inside the wounds with any semblance of clarity, it appears that the cobalt plating is not hollow but an armored skin protecting something inorganic within. She walks for minutes until finally coming back around to what must have been its gargantuan head. Here a puncture wound piercing it from jaw to crown leaks a cerulean ichor, still wet to the touch...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.X1.dialogue_text: But this is all she can determine from her current investigations and now is left with no other options but to return whence she entered.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.10.dialogue_text: Before her thought can be completed, Eidos feels a stirring awareness. As she recollects her experiences from lives both lived and unlived, a sympathetic memory shimmers about this place. As though the forlorn carcass had struck a tuning fork, calling forth a tone of her frequency, she feels the resonance of its memory. With her waking eyes, she can see the creature unwither before her.

Lost, not in space but in purpose, Wulfias rides his two war beasts into the ancient edifice. He recognizes the mark of Hamlik upon this Dynamic Knowledge Repository and utterly resents it. His trail from slave to general had always been blazed by his desires, his will, yet somehow the Masters control him even in this place.

Crafting a Sigil, he forges his identity as Archon and quickly seals off all exits. He finally has time to think. Yet when he does, none come to mind but the one person who had helped him without expecting anything in return. The only person he had ever truly betrayed.

He had lied to people countless times before, deceived them into a false sense of kinship. In truth, Wulfias' intent with Rikharr was no different... initially, at least. But eventually, he came to realize that he trusted the Kaban. Trust. An emotion a slave can ill afford. Yet, even as the Masters ruthlessly experimented upon Wulfias, Rikharr did all he could to help him learn, to teach him.

The thought, quasi-formed and hideous, soon gains shape, gains focus, becomes intelligible. Though Wulfias scoffs instinctively at his hope for atonement, it is all that is left to him. If he cannot help Rikharr now, he will help him and generations of his people. He will build a Wellspring upon this very site, so that Kabans will never be without water in this cruel region...

The vision abruptly terminates and Eidos is left standing before the solemn mouth of Gurgadon. Yet she is likewise left with a bizarre desire to sit down beside the beast and rest with it. Though she knows, somehow, that if she were to give in to this bout of nostalgia, the effects would be irreversible.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!0.11.dialogue_text: And yet for reasons Eidos may never understand, she sits and rests alongside her former companion through countless cycles of day and night, through countless iterations of dying smoke. No new visions visit her mind, but to some odd degree she is at peace. And it is only then the Self realizes that in relinquishing Eidos, it can move on to its next vessel, in some distant land, at some remote time. Its ghost regards the Falseflesh it leaves behind this time as it floats off into the infinite.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SANCTUM OF GURGADON!1.00.dialogue_text: As Eidos reaches the end of the passage, she enters a familiar rectilinear chamber. She has returned to Gurgadon's Sanctum, its peaceful occupant yet resting in lifeless repose.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SCRIPTORIUM!0.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a room punctuated by broken desks, victims of the recent rubble shower from the spontaneous destruction of the floor above it. Aside from detritus, the place is strewn with tomes, parchment, pens and quills - or at least the remains of such items. Likely, this place is dedicated to reading and copying the many volumes that line the shelves along the walls.\n\n\t\tTwo chambers lead from here, both identified by simple wooden placards placed above their corresponding door frames. One of them reads 'Living Quarters', the other claiming 'Gate of the Heathen' as its name. Though the contents of these halls are difficult to determine from this location, a faint smell of rotting meat permeates the entire area.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SCRIPTORIUM!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in a room filled with tomes, parchment, pens and quills, and is likely dedicated to reading and copying the many volumes that line the shelves along the walls.\n\n\t\tTwo chambers lead from here, both identified by simple wooden placards placed above their corresponding door frames. One of them reads 'Living Quarters', the other claiming 'Gate of the Heathen' as its name. Though the contents of these halls are difficult to determine from this location, a faint smell of rotting meat permeates the entire area.

C.response_text: Take the lift up one floor

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Light appears to be in short supply. What little aid Eidos' strained eyes do receive bleeds in from large gashes in the domed ceiling far above. However, those exposed patches of starlight burned in the midnight sky rain down enough of their bounty to make out the shapes and sizes of all objects within the chamber. While the stars were myriad fireflies in the great abyss of the Ravine, here their power is blurred, distorted, and yet unified. Their ambient glow seems to coalesce around a shining silver throne, as though it wore a shroud woven from spiraling flecks of mist and light.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.001!DESC.dialogue_text: This room is a strange concoction of ruin and ritual, accident and artifice. The floor gently crackles with her every step as though eggshells lined her path. Looking down, Eidos notes that the floor was once made of titanic slabs of stone, each perhaps twice as wide as she is tall and half again as long, yet all are now shattered. Cracks spread out like spiderwebs from focused wounds in the slabs.\n\n\t\tGaze again shifting skywards, Eidos observes that the many dark panes of the ceiling mirror the ground in their destruction. Nearly all are marred by countless fractures streaking across their surfaces like sparks frozen in time.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Yet, the room's utter ruin stands in stark opposition to its centerpiece. The metallic throne abates the encroaching pandemonium, a defiant rock standing amid the crashing waves of entropy. It is surrounded by clay vessels of water, eight in number. From these eight points, white chalk radiates outward, marking a spiraling pathway through the chamber. The line connects each impact point to the central throne, octagons within squares within circles surrounding each point. Unlit candles have been placed along this path and the smell of incense still lingers in the air.\n\n\t\tThe perfection and symmetry given to these tracings battle Nature's tendency toward anarchy, serving as an imposition of order upon chaos, stability upon uncertainty.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Aside from the way back to the Ravine, there are two exits from the chamber. One is a ruined but open gate; the other gate remains closed.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.X100!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos carefully steps across the cracking surface and over the designs, momentarily darkening the shimmering glow of reflected starlight as though she were a storm cloud blotting out the sun. The silvered throne appears to blur as she draws nearer and clarity eludes her vision despite conquering physical distance. The surface appears to have melted slightly, as if it had once been exposed to intense heat.\n\n\t\tAn irresistible urge to sit upon the chair emerges, and without understanding why, she sits. All about her, a lingering whisper echoes, yet she does not feel the vibrations of a physical sound. The whisper crescendos through the power of mechanisms unseen until language emerges.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.200!DESC.dialogue_text: Looking to the left, Eidos sees a metallic gate, composed of thousands of interlocking plates like the scales of a forged serpent. It may once have been a mechanical marvel, but it now stands immobile, frozen in time and laying bare its secrets. The semi-circular tunnel beyond it is wide enough to fit fifty men abreast. To the right, a nearly identical gate resides. This twin is of similar composition, but unlike its candid brother, this gate is sealed shut.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.201!DESC.dialogue_text: Walking past the threshold, the air becomes murky and suffocating. While the previous area carried the scent of incense, this place reeks of it. The smell and murk become ever denser until it is as if she were walking through a fog...

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!0.300!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the the Silver Shrine. The scene before her is heavy with the memory of ritual and incantation. The stars twinkle eternally in this quiet place as traces of burning incense waft through the air from Gurgadon's Sanctum.

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!1.000!FATH.dialogue_text: "...Wulfias. As Archon reckoned. The stored memory unreadable is. All strength lost is. Gurgadon the Mover unmade is.. Only Gulganna.. lives..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!SILVER SHRINE!1.001!FATH.dialogue_text: "Might.. spent... Sleep comes.. Further reckonings... unfathoma..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!0.X000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a place of hallowed worship. Several crystalline sconces pour their dim, amber light down into the room - though, this dying incandescence seems to feel gravity's pull tenfold, leaving the ceiling drowned in a sea of shadows. The room's center is occupied by a raised altar of some sort, with bowls of offering placed upon it.\n\n\t\tMost notable of all, perhaps, are the two statues flanking the altar. They look to be crafted from wood, and clothed in dark raiments. Their form is a hybrid of human shape and avian features. Their feet are clawed with red-accented, ivory talons, and their elongated faces, though veiled in scarves, provide the impression of beaks.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!0.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Two chambers lead from here and both are identified by simple wooden placards placed above the door frames. One of them reads 'Living Quarters', the other 'Gate of the Heathen'. Though the contents of these halls are difficult to determine from this location, a faint smell of rotting meat permeates the air.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The area seems to have seen recent use, as evidenced by the pristine bands of clothing the avian figures don. Closer inspection reveals that the altar bears two wide and shallow bowls of offering. One is filled with water, the other with a dark, reddish-brown liquid, emanating a rather rank odor.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The area seems to have seen recent use, as evidenced by the pristine bands of clothing the avian figures don. Closer inspection reveals that the altar bears two wide and shallow bowls of offering. One is filled with water, the other with a dark, reddish-brown liquid, emanating a rather rank odor.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.0020!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Turning her attention towards the statues, Eidos is struck by the sense of familiarity she feels. They are precisely the same as those detailed in the tome she discovered at the excavation site - which excavation site precisely, she cannot recall. Then she realizes, their heads, though still as stone, appear to be facing her... though perhaps they always were.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.003!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The area seems to have seen recent use, as evidenced by the pristine bands of clothing the avian figures don. Closer inspection reveals that the altar bears two wide and shallow bowls of offering. One is filled with water, the other with a dark, reddish-brown liquid, emanating a rather rank odor.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.0030!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos of course recognizes these statues as the ones that had previously chased her. The darkness behind their scarves stares at Eidos, entrancing her, pulling her into its deadly embrace...

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!1.0031!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Memories of pursuit and attempted evisceration, the pain of past wounds, the taste of blood, all these bring her back to reality - to a reality where the crows yet stare at her, unmoving and silent, in perfect imitation of statues.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!10.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a place of hallowed worship. Several crystalline sconces pour their dim, amber light down into the room - though, this dying incandescence seems to feel gravity's pull tenfold, leaving the ceiling drowned in a sea of shadows.\n\n\t\tAt the room's center, an altar extends upwards from the floor, growing skywards like a rectilinear stalagmite. The two columns upon which the killer statues once perched are now vacant. Their corpses have vanished, almost as though consumed by the Wellspring itself.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!10.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Two chambers lead from here and both are identified by simple wooden placards placed above the door frames. One of them reads "Living Quarters", the other "Gates of the Heathen". Though the contents of these halls are difficult to determine from this location, a faint smell of rotting meat permeates the air.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!502.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos dashes into the Temple. The two columns upon which the statues once perched are now vacant. The clicking sound of ivory claws on stone close behind leaves not doubt that this room's former occupants are still intent on finishing their work. Leaving droplets of blood trailing behind her, Eidos makes for the darkened room...

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!502.X100!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos picks up the sacrificial bowls and violently bashes the statues into dust, easily rendering them harmless. Their speed and agility no longer an advantage, as surprise and blunt force from heavy metals break them quickly.\n\n\t\tHaving disabled the threat the statues posed, it is now time for Eidos to move on.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!502.101!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos summons Luin to dispense with the statues; Luin gladly obliges. For only the destruction of such fearsome foes brings delight to the ghelblade of Vanargand.\n\n\t\tBut as with all actions of impulse and emotion, it ends almost as soon as it begins. Now, the void left by this bloodlust must be tamed so that Eidos can control her quivering hands.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!502.102!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Taking deep and measured breaths, Eidos returns serenity to her previously agitated Falseflesh. The bloodlust subsides, but its effects leave a permanent mark upon her mind.

KABU!WELLSPRING!TEMPLE!502.103!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Calmer now, she can see two paths of egress from this nightmarish Temple.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a pitch darkness. As she proceeds, the echoes from her footsteps clicking on the tiled floor betray the immensity of the chamber. Ten paces in, all shadows are exiled to the realm of memory as countless lights in the floor and ceiling spring to life. The reflective black dome above her, the walls of dark granite, the intricately carved designs in a lattice of forbidden geometries, all of these reveal themselves to her light-shocked eyes.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Rubbing the tears away, Eidos tries to take it all in. But she is somewhat overwhelmed by the grandeur of the place. For a moment, she even feels at a loss, as though she could lose her very Self just from being here...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: But before long, the spell is broken and she regains her bearings. Examining the dome, she focuses on the large panes of black glass filling in the spaces between the stonework, all trimmed and gilded in a silvery metal. They share a strong resemblance to the ones she encountered in the Sanctuary.\n\n\t\tAt the opposite end of the chamber, an enormous and robust door blocks passage with its overlapping metallic scales. The dominant feature of the chamber, however, is the high-backed, silver throne that appears to grow right out of the floor's center.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X50!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
She approaches the chair. Dragging a finger across the grooves in the armrest, she begins to circle the throne. It has a beauty both flamboyant and austere; just as a silver ingot may shine and sparkle, yet is still simply a hunk of metal, so too does this throne walk the line between simplicity and extravagance.

		After she completes her round,Eidos sits upon the throne. To her right, a small stone column rises from the floor. It is lined and laced with strands of liquid silver.

		Then, the emanation of a thought pulses from the contraption. A sense of expectation fills Eidos' mind... An expectation she, unfortunately, cannot fulfill. And as such, she rises from the chair and the stone column recedes.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She approaches the chair. Dragging a finger across the grooves in the armrest, she begins to circle the throne. It has a beauty both flamboyant and austere; just as a silver ingot may shine and sparkle, yet is still simply a hunk of metal, so too does this throne walk the line between simplicity and extravagance.\n\n\t\tAfter she completes her round, Eidos sits in the chair. All about her, the dark glass panels spring to life, displaying myriad scattered images, flowing one from the next. However, the panel directly in front of her remains fixed on a single image, frozen in time. This panel shows the body of water she witnessed on her way here.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5000!DESC.dialogue_text: Suddenly, a small stone column rises from the floor to her right. The column is lined and laced with strands of liquid silver, gently rippling on the surface. Then, the emanation of a thought pulses out from the contraption. A sense of expectation fills Eidos' mind and a choir of a thousand voices rings out...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5010!DESC.dialogue_text: The one frozen image from the panels revives as a great rumble stirs Eidosâ€™ innards. Thereupon, the dam lowers, finally releasing the water it so dutifully kept at bay. The sound of rushing water echoes from outside and into the Throne Room, confirming the underground lake now rages forward into the aqueduct.\n\n\t\tHowever, soon a different sound from above draws her gaze upward. From the ceiling, a descending cloudstone reveals a passage skyward.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5020!DESC.dialogue_text: The one frozen image from the panels revives as a great rumble stirs Eidosâ€™ innards. Thereupon, the dam lowers, finally releasing the water it so dutifully kept at bay. The sound of rushing water echoes from outside and into the Throne Room, confirming the underground lake now rages forward into the aqueduct.\n\n\t\tHowever, soon a different sound from above draws her gaze upward. From the ceiling, a descending cloudstone reveals a passage skyward.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5030!DESC.dialogue_text: The voice barely finishes before the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent.\n\n\t\tThe cloudstone yet awaits to take her skyward, should it please her.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.5040!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos climbs up on to the cloudstone and it immediately begins its ascent...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5011!DESC.dialogue_text: The one frozen image from the panels revives as a great rumble stirs Eidosâ€™ innards. Thereupon, the dam lowers, finally releasing the water it so dutifully kept at bay. The sound of rushing water echoes from outside and into the Throne Room, confirming the underground lake now rages forward into the aqueduct.

A.response_text: Go to watch the water drain

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5021!DESC.dialogue_text: The one frozen image from the panels revives as a great rumble stirs Eidosâ€™ innards. Thereupon, the dam lowers, finally releasing the water it so dutifully kept at bay. The sound of rushing water echoes from outside and into the Throne Room, confirming the underground lake now rages forward into the aqueduct.

B.response_text: Go to watch the water drain

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5031!DESC.dialogue_text: The voice barely finishes before the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5012!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos rises from the throne and prepares for her next course of action.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5022!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos rises from the throne and prepares for her next course of action.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!0.X5032!DESC.dialogue_text: The voice barely finishes before the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos and Quangjo enter a pitch darkness. Here, the echoes from their footsteps clicking on the tiled floor betray the vast size of this chamber. But soon, shadows are sent into the realm of memory as countless lights in the floor and ceiling spring to life. The reflective black dome above their heads, the walls of dark granite, and intricately carved designs in a lattice of forbidden geometries all reveal themselves to their now watery eyes.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Wiping the moisture from her eyes, Eidos tries to take it all in. But she is somewhat overwhelmed by the grandeur of the place - not to mention the sudden radiance. For a moment she even feels at a loss, as though she could lose her very Self just from being here...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: But before long, the spell is broken and she regains her bearings. Examining the dome, She soon sees large panes of black glass filling in the spaces between the stonework. Further, she notes that much of the environment is trimmed and gilded in a silvery metal. At the opposite end of the chamber, an enormous and robust door blocks passage with its overlapping metallic scales. However, the dominant feature of the chamber is undoubtedly the high-backed, silver throne seemingly growing right out of the floor's center.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.X500!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos sits in the chair, as the Librarian mutters inaudibly to himself. All about her, the dark glass panels springs to life, showing myriad scattered images, flowing one from the next. The one directly before depicts the pool into which she had fallen - the one where Quangjo rescued her. And then, a voice rings out...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!11.X001!DESC.dialogue_text: Displayed upon the brilliant pane, the dam lowers and releases the water. The sound of rushing water echoes from outside and into the Throne Room, confirming the underground lake now rages forward into the aqueduct. However, soon a different sound sound from above draws her gaze upward. Descending from the ceiling, a cloudstone reveals a passage skyward.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.5040!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos climbs up on to the floating platform, yet Quangjo remains behind. Before she can say a word, Eidos is immediately thrust upward and onward, leaving the Librarian in the fog of experiences passed...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!11.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Quangjo draws a rusty blade from his sleeve and quickly dashes towards Eidos, taking a wild swing.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!12.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The voice barely finishes before the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!12.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then, Quangjo begins walking towards the aperture pausing briefly to look back at Eidos. With a nod of his head, he signals her to proceed.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Quangjo's blood spills out, soiling the pristine floors in a final act of protest. Despite all his efforts, the poisoned water now makes its way to the doomed denizens of the Dawn Fortress. In the space of a thought, a rather peculiar emanation begins to pour forth from the Falseflesh that was Quangjo, as his knowledge crystallizes into material form.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Quangjo's blood spills out, soiling the pristine floors in a final act of protest. Despite all his efforts, the poisoned water now makes its way to the doomed denizens of the Dawn Fortress. In the space of a thought, the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos walks over to Quangjo's corpse, she begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull. With a growing sense of clarity, Eidos feels the awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, attempting to etch themselves within her mind.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.011!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos walks over to Quangjo's corpse, she begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull. With a growing sense of clarity, Eidos feels the awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, attempting to etch themselves within her mind. One of them calls out to her.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.021!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos walks over to Quangjo's corpse, she begins to feel a presence within the lifeless skull. With a growing sense of clarity, Eidos feels the awareness of symbols still living within the dead man, attempting to etch themselves within her mind. One of them calls out to her.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.031!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos walks over to Quangjo's corpse, simply observing the pathetic Librarian for a moment. Is he doomed to such an ignoble death in perpetuity? Or could enough Awareness afford the ability to avoid such pitfalls as it does Eidos? But enough of pointless musings, Eidos must move on.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Abruptly, she is seized by a vision of feverish labor. Black-inked fingers. The taste of fish. The smell of tome-rot. A gnawing sense of impending doom. Wasted hours of panic and terror. Certainty that she is being watched from within by a demon beyond man's grasp. Desperation. Hunger. Fear. And further, streets of white quartz stained with seething shadows - or is it the ink upon the tomes? An angelic, winged creature watches her from atop a heaven piercing spire. And then...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos now hears thousands of whispers crescendoing into a cacophonous din of incomprehensible words racing through her Falseflesh, before making contact with her ghost's Trueflesh. Upon the very meeting of the tome and Eidos' mind, they intertwine inextricably and eternally. Bound and grafted to the same soul, they now travel as one. Then...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.004!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos shields her will against the living knowledge that appears before her mind's eye. Slowly, she feels the urgent call subside as whatever structures supporting the vitality of the symbols wither away into nothingness - memory now consigned to oblivion. She is alone with only the cooling Falseflesh of the Librarian who once was, but no longer is.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.X005!DESC.dialogue_text: Having mourned the Librarians death in her own way, Eidos is now left with the decision of how to proceed.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.0050!DESC.dialogue_text: Having mourned the Librarians death in her own way, Eidos is now left with the decision of how to proceed. But then...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!40.0051!DESC.dialogue_text: In the space of a thought, the frame surrounding the gate at the far side of the room springs into luminescence. Suddenly, the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. It splits and divides into many smaller plates that are drawn into the walls, doing so in almost total silence. A rush of air inundates the Throne Room from the adjoining area, as though a deific exhalation. It carries with it a distinctly odorless scent.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!43.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: The vision subsides. Now having stolen the spoils of murder from her victim, Eidos is left to contemplate her options.

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!43.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Having stolen the spoils of murder from her victim, Eidos is now left to contemplate her options... But suddenly...

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!50.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos manages to topple Quangjo to the ground causing him to bump his head on the Silver Throne, affording her an opportunity to make for the Flood Gate. This path may take her to safety and free her from the jinncrazed Librarian.

B.response_text: Command using the Glyph of Purification

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!1.000!FATHOM.dialogue_text: "Fathom, speaker for the Wellspring, before you. Wulfias. As Archon reckoned."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!1.X001!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Within the waters death lives. A memory, penned by Glyphs of Wulfias and Corruption. To save life, the water flow I stemmed. All guardians are awakened. Further harm halted."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!1.0011!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Within the waters death lives. A memory, penned by Glyphs of Wulfias and Corruption. To save life, the water flow I stemmed. All Arclights and Clockwork Crows are awakened. Further harm halted."

B.response_text: Use the Glyph of Purification and release water

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!1.X101!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Archon will reckoned. The tainted water released."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!1.X102!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Archon will reckoned. My mind remade. The corrupted Glyph curtailed. The untainted water released."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!4.X001!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Gulganna the Mover beyond this door awaits. Does Archon will see it opened?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!4.001!FATHOM.dialogue_text: "Gulganna the Mover beyond this door awaits. Does Archon will see it opened?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!4.X101!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Archon will reckoned. The Mover's gate unsealed."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!5.001!FATHOM.dialogue_text: "Wulfias stands in error. His will unreckonable by my might."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.000!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Fathom, Memory of the Wellspring Thought Wheel."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!11.X001!FATH.dialogue_text: "Within the waters death lives. A memory, penned by Glyphs of Wulfias and Corruption. To save life, the water flow I stemmed. All guardians are awakened. Further harm halted."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!14.001!FATHO.dialogue_text: "Gulganna the Mover beyond this door awaits. Does Archon will see it opened?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.X000!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Listen, Master Khaa! The Wellspring speaks to us, yes..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0000!QUAN.dialogue_text: "It knows of our transgression and commands us to rid the water of its contamination, so that the Tacribians might yet live!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0001!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Mmm, I had read that this place was enchanted by the Heathen long ago. But the records never imparted the wonder of his Techne... that he could fashion mind and will from nothingness!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.001!QUANG.dialogue_text: "Mmm, I knew Biracul was capable of such works, yes, but to think that a mere man could've accomplished such a miracle!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0010!QUAN.dialogue_text: "A shame that his name is unspoken by our people!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0011!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Now mage-leader, our work is clear. I must use the Glyph of Purification and atone for the wrongs we've committed..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0012!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Listen, Master Khaa! The Wellspring speaks to us."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0013!QUAN.dialogue_text: "It knows of our transgression and commands us to rid the water of its contamination, so that the Tacribians might yet live!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0014!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Mmm, I had read that this place was enchanted by the Heathen long ago. But the records did not impart the wonder of his Techne... that he could fashion mind and will from nothingness!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0015!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Mmm, I knew Biracul was capable of such works, but to think that a mere man could have accomplished such a miracle!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0016!QUAN.dialogue_text: "A shame that his name is unspoken by our people!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.0017!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Now mage-leader, our work is clear. I must use the Glyph of Purification and atone for the wrongs we've committed..."

E.response_text: "I will not allow it."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.499!QUANG.dialogue_text: "Then the Wellspring's Voice'll take heed and purify the water! Once cleansed, our Tacribian brethren'll be saved, yes!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.4990!QUAN.dialogue_text: "You humble me with your piety, master! What caused the Will of Biracul to awaken within you I will never know, no, but you're not the same cruel man that trained me, no!"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.500!QUANG.dialogue_text: "...Ah, but this is how it must be, no?"

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.5000!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Since you demand the Tacribians' blood, I'll... abstain."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.5001!QUAN.dialogue_text: "I see that despite the holiness of our work, the Will of Biracul hasn't awoken within you, no..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.5002!QUAN.dialogue_text: "Forgive me, Master Khaa. Mmm, I can't wait another lifetime for you to walk the Path of Awareness..."

KABU!WELLSPRING!THRONE ROOM!10.5003!QUAN.dialogue_text: "I hope that you'll see the truth when you awaken in the realm of Trueflesh..."
